alert.note: Alert for Eddy County Plains; Guadalupe Mountains of Eddy County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 4:55PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN EDDY COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 8 miles west of Carlsbad Caverns National Park, or 16 miles northeast of Pine Springs, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Carlsbad, Brantley Lake State Park, Avalon, Carlsbad North, Seven Rivers Airport, Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Lincoln National Forest, Queen, Lake Avalon, Living Desert State Park, and Cavern City Air Terminal. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eddy County Plains; Guadalupe Mountains of Eddy County
